### Overview

Meitong Zhou holds a dual bachelorâ€™s degree in economics from the University of Colorado, Denver, and China Agricultural University (CAU), achieving a GPA of 3.86 and receiving multiple academic scholarships. With solid skills in economic analysis, Zhou has completed impactful internships, including roles at Hejun Consulting and China Securities, where they produced reports, conducted financial analyses, and advised on investment strategies. Zhou researched SHAP values in genetic epidemiology under Professor Jun Liu from Oxford University, showcasing an interdisciplinary approach bridging biostatistics and economics. Academic projects include econometric modeling on dietary trends and risk assessment studies by age, utilizing software like Stata and SPSS. Zhou has published work on marketing strategies and economic methodologies, complemented by leadership roles in public relations and mental health support at CAU.
